als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
In the mutant SOD1 mouse model of ALS,
oral resveratrol was successful in increasing
SIRT1 expression with expected changes in
several downstream targets. This occurred
in the motor neurons located in the lumbar
spinal cord of the mice. Data from humans
without neurodegenerative disease indicates
resveratrol may raise SIRT1 expression, at
least in the blood, but CNS-specific SIRT1
activation has not been studied.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
In several studies with the transgenic SOD1
(G93A mutation) mouse model of ALS,
resveratrol was successful in slowing disease
progression. There was only one study that
found benefits with oral supplementation;
this study was reasonably well-conducted.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
We know of one PALS that experienced an
“ALS reversal” in association with a multisupplement cocktail that included
resveratrol. We independently verified the
ALS diagnosis and a substantial and
sustained partial reversal of ALS disease,
but it is unknown if resveratrol was a factor
in this improvement.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: There are no trials of resveratrol in ALS.

preclinical_description:
In several studies with the transgenic SOD1
(G93A mutation) mouse model of ALS,
resveratrol was successful in slowing disease
progression. There was only one study that

this study was reasonably well-conducted.

resveratrol. We independently verified the

sustained partial reversal of ALS disease,
but it is unknown if resveratrol was a factor
in this improvement.
trials_description: There are no trials of resveratrol in ALS.
name: Resveratrol

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: Melatonin treatment can reduce biomarkers of oxidative stress and inflammation in humans with MS and ALS
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: Some (but not all) flawed studies in an ALS mouse model suggest benefits
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: 2 patients with validated ALS diagnoses experienced validated improvements (ALS reversals) on cocktails of treatments including melatonin
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: We found no trials comparing clinical outcomes in PALS on melatonin versus controls

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Perampanel non-competitively inhibits
AMPA receptors in cell culture and
animal brain slices. AMPA receptors
undergo a gain of function in ALS
which likely contributes to glutamate
excitotoxicity of motor neurons.
Perampanel could potentially reduce
this excitation by blocking
AMPA receptors
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
One flawed study in a mouse model of
ALS reported perampanel slows motor
function loss with corresponding
histologic changes in the spinal cord
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
We found a single person reporting a
“slight” benefit in their ALS disease
from perampanel. We were unable to
verify their diagnosis or
reported benefit
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: We found no published ALS trials of perampanel

trials_description: We found no published ALS trials of perampanel
name: Perampanel

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: Tamoxifen can reduce biomarkers of oxidative stress in humans
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: Flawed studies in TDP-43 overexpressing mice show that tamoxifen treatment was associated with improved motor and memory function
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: One ALS expert reported an improvement in ALS progression on tamoxifen in his patient
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description:
Small trials suggest that tamoxifen
treatment at higher doses such as 40mg
or 80mg daily is associated with
improved survival and ALS progression
compared to treatment at lower doses
or with creatine or a placebo

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: ALCAR increased blood ATP levels suggestive of increased mitochondrial energy production in a single human study.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: Two research groups showed benefits of oral ALCAR in two different mouse models of ALS. Neither of these studies have been published in a peerreviewed journal.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: One PALS with a validated diagnosis experienced substantial and sustained functional improvement (“ALS reversal”) on a multi-compound regimen that included ALCAR.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: A single randomized double-blinded placebo-controlled clinical trial reported benefits in PALS; however, violations of protocol in subject selection, as well as, post-hoc sub-analysis of the results requires that the results be interpreted with caution.

mechanism_description: ALCAR increased blood ATP levels suggestive of increased mitochondrial energy production in a single human study.
preclinical_description: Two research groups showed benefits of oral ALCAR in two different mouse models of ALS. Neither of these studies have been published in a peerreviewed journal.

trials_description: A single randomized double-blinded placebo-controlled clinical trial reported benefits in PALS; however, violations of protocol in subject selection, as well as, post-hoc sub-analysis of the results requires that the results be interpreted with caution.
name: Acetyl-L-Carnitine

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
ARVs are effective against some aspects of
the retroviral lifecycle, but it is
unknown if ARVs will lead to a positive
outcome in ALS pathophysiology
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
One flawed pre-clinical study with a
Drosophila model of ALS reported
some benefit with ARVs of the NRTI
class.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: We found no cases of PALS using ARVs.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description:
Two published trials in PALS, each using
a different ARV in monotherapy,
showed no benefit.

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Components of ayahuasca can increase
GLT-1 receptors, modulate serotonin and
affect S1R receptors, actions which could
theoretically help slow ALS progression.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: We found no trials of ayahuasca in ALS models.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: We found reports of subjective improvements in patients who used ayahuasca without validated diagnoses. We also found one unpublished case of a validated ALS reversal in a patient who used ayahuasca one time. In our opinion, it is highly unlikely that a single dose of ayahuasca could have triggered a biological mechanism that could have caused this ALS reversal.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: We found no published trials of ayahuasca in PALS

mechanism_description:

theoretically help slow ALS progression.
preclinical_description: We found no trials of ayahuasca in ALS models.
case_description: We found reports of subjective improvements in patients who used ayahuasca without validated diagnoses. We also found one unpublished case of a validated ALS reversal in a patient who used ayahuasca one time. In our opinion, it is highly unlikely that a single dose of ayahuasca could have triggered a biological mechanism that could have caused this ALS reversal.
trials_description: We found no published trials of ayahuasca in PALS
name: Ayahuasca

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: AZA can decrease NF-jB expression in a mouse model of ulcerative colitis; theoretically this same effect might allow it to slow ALS progression
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: We found no studies of AZA in recognized pre-clinical models of ALS
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: Two validated “ALS” reversals in a peer reviewed publication were taking AZA during their recovery
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: Two small trials in PALS showed no benefit from taking AZA

trials_description: Two small trials in PALS showed no benefit from taking AZA

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: CuATSM can ameliorate CNS copper dysregulation and alter progression in animal models of SOD1 ALS; relevance in other types of ALS is less certain
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
Multiple well-designed studies in peer reviewed
publications show that
CuATSM can slow progression in ALS animal
models
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: A few PALS have reported benefits, but they were on combinations of treatments and we did not have records to validate their diagnoses or improvements
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: There is a small pilot trial underway but results are not available yet

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Numerous observations suggest a role of oxidative stress in driving
ALS progression and there are specific reductions in GSH in the
blood and motor cortex of PALS. However, it is not year clear that
taking any form of glutathione or cysteine-containing supplement
can elevate human motor cortex glutathione levels or slow human
ALS progression
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
Increasing GSH was beneficial in flawed studies in some but not all
cell and animal models of ALS
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
Within a published cohort of validated “ALS reversals” 2 patients
were taking glutathione during their recovery (and one of these
was also taking NAC)
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description:
Small trials of glutathione and acetylcysteine (to raise glutathione) in
PALS showed no significant benefits

preclinical_description:

case_description:
Within a published cohort of validated “ALS reversals” 2 patients
were taking glutathione during their recovery (and one of these
was also taking NAC)
trials_description:
Small trials of glutathione and acetylcysteine (to raise glutathione) in
PALS showed no significant benefits
name: Glutathione

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Glucocorticoids have failed to affect neuroinflammation in ways that beneficially alter ALS disease
progression in clinical trials. There is little scientific evidence that GABA is contributing to ALS
pathogenesis. PNG can increase glutamate uptake and slow ALS progression in an animal model, but
a drug that does this more potently did not work in a human ALS trial.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: We found no studies testing PNG and/or HC in preclinical models of ALS.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: A case series of 3 Dutch PALS reportedly experiencing benefits from PNG/HC was published; however, we did not receive medical records to confirm the ALS diagnoses or improvements.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: While likely underpowered, this failed to show any benefit of this treatment on ALS progression. As a result of this, we change our “trials” grade from “U” to “F.” We change the last sentence of our conclusion to: "In light of the lack of a convincing mechanism and this negative clinical trial, we do not recommend that PALS take this expensive and risky combination of penicillin G and hydrocortisone."

As a result of this, we change our “trials” grade from “U” to “F.” We change the last sentence of our conclusion to: "In light of the lack of a convincing mechanism and this negative clinical trial, we do not recommend that PALS take this expensive and risky combination of penicillin G and hydrocortisone."
name: Penicillin G/Hydrocortisone

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
PLC improved blood biomarkers of
antioxidants and oxidative stress in
several studies and increased blood
ATP levels suggestive of increased
mitochondrial energy prodution in a
single study.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: We found no studies testing PLC in preclinical models of ALS.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: We found no cases of PALS taking PLC.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: We found no trials testing PLC that enrolled PALS.

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Protandim can increase antioxidant levels
and decrease markers of lipid peroxidation in humans
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: No known studies of Protandim in preclinical ALS models
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
One unpublished report of Protandim
benefit with a validated ALS diagnosis
and benefits in ALSFRS-R score
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: No known trials of Protandim or any other Nfr2 activators in ALS

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Purported to target B cells and a downtream agent. We have seen no convincing evidence
that RCH4 does this.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description:
The RCH4 website describes a study in an ALS animal model but there are not enough
details provided for us to scientifically review it
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
We were able to independently confirm an ALS diagnosis and slowing in ALSFRS-R
progression in 1 person on RCH4
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: We found no trials of RCH4 in PALS

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: RT001 has been shown to lower brain oxidative stress in several animal models of neurodegenerative disease.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: The only available study in an ALS model showed no benefits.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: One PALS taking RT001 for 4 months had small improvements in ALSFRS-R score, FVC and speech. We did not independently confirm his diagnosis or improvements.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: No clinical trials of RT001 in PALS have been conducted.

mechanism_description: RT001 has been shown to lower brain oxidative stress in several animal models of neurodegenerative disease.
preclinical_description: The only available study in an ALS model showed no benefits.
case_description: One PALS taking RT001 for 4 months had small improvements in ALSFRS-R score, FVC and speech. We did not independently confirm his diagnosis or improvements.
trials_description: No clinical trials of RT001 in PALS have been conducted.
name: RT001

als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: ALNP001 has been studied in the C57B1/6 G93A congenic SOD mouse model of ALS (16). Nineteen mice given NP001 every three weeks (fi ve days on, 16 days off) starting at 65 days survived 13 days longer and had slower decline in blinded neuroscore evaluations compared to saline injected animals.

preclinical_description: ALNP001 has been studied in the C57B1/6 G93A congenic SOD mouse model of ALS (16). Nineteen mice given NP001 every three weeks (fi ve days on, 16 days off) starting at 65 days survived 13 days longer and had slower decline in blinded neuroscore evaluations compared to saline injected animals.
name: Sodium Chlorite NP001

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description:
Vinpocetine can enter the brain and affect
5 mechanisms that are believed to be
important in ALS: hyperexcitability,
excitotoxicity, oxidative stress,
neuroinflammation and mitochondrial
dysfunction. Its effects on
neuroinflammation biomarkers have
been demonstrated in a human trial.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: We found no studies of Vinpocetine in recognized pre-clinical models of ALS.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description:
We found 2 PALS reporting that
supplement cocktails including
Vinpocetine were associated with
improved motor function, but we did
not have records to independently verify
their diagnoses or improvements.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description:
We found no trials of Vinpocetine
in PALS.

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: Vitamin C can reduce serum markers of oxidative stress but there is little evidence that it reduces these in brain or CSF
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: Two flawed studies in an ALS mouse model suggest benefits
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: 2 patients with validated ALS diagnoses experienced validated improvements (ALS reversals) on cocktails of treatments including vitamin C
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: A small trial comparing vitamin C (along with 5 other antioxidants) to placebo showed no statistical benefit

mechanism_description: Vitamin C can reduce serum markers of oxidative stress but there is little evidence that it reduces these in brain or CSF
preclinical_description: Two flawed studies in an ALS mouse model suggest benefits
case_description: 2 patients with validated ALS diagnoses experienced validated improvements (ALS reversals) on cocktails of treatments including vitamin C
trials_description: A small trial comparing vitamin C (along with 5 other antioxidants) to placebo showed no statistical benefit
name: Vitamin C

name: Vitamin D

als_untangled_interventions.mechanism_description: Multiple double-blind RCTs in participants without neurological disease show that moderately high doses of daily vitamin E supplementation for at least 4 months can lower blood and urine biomarkers of oxidative stress.
als_untangled_interventions.preclinical_description: 2 flawed studies in the SOD1 mutant mouse model showed a benefit of delayed disease onset, but no benefit on survival was observed.
als_untangled_interventions.case_description: There has been at least one published case report where the ALS diagnosis was clear and the patient had a substantial benefit on vitamin E with adequate follow-up. We however caution that there have also been over 200 published case reports with no benefits.
als_untangled_interventions.trials_description: 2 randomized double-blinded placebocontrolled trials showed no benefit of vitamin E on accepted ALS outcome measures despite adequate statistical power, high dosage, and long duration.

mechanism_description: Multiple double-blind RCTs in participants without neurological disease show that moderately high doses of daily vitamin E supplementation for at least 4 months can lower blood and urine biomarkers of oxidative stress.
preclinical_description: 2 flawed studies in the SOD1 mutant mouse model showed a benefit of delayed disease onset, but no benefit on survival was observed.
case_description: There has been at least one published case report where the ALS diagnosis was clear and the patient had a substantial benefit on vitamin E with adequate follow-up. We however caution that there have also been over 200 published case reports with no benefits.
trials_description: 2 randomized double-blinded placebocontrolled trials showed no benefit of vitamin E on accepted ALS outcome measures despite adequate statistical power, high dosage, and long duration.
name: Vitamin E
